adjectives.description: foreright (comparative more foreright, superlative most foreright)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Characterising a wind blowing on the line of one's travel; favourable.
examples: Ther's a foreright winde continuall wafts vs till we come at Virginia.

adverbs.description: foreright (comparative more foreright, superlative most foreright)

examples: [H]alf of them […] look'd upward, and side-ways, or foreright, and backward, which variety I have not found in any other small Fly.
